techmeme.title: Sources: the US is preparing rules restricting the sale of GPUs to some countries in Southeast Asia and the Middle East, to limit China's ability to access them (Wall Street Journal)
In a blog post, OpenAI says "You can't sue your way to AGI", and publishes emails from Elon Musk showing he wanted to own OpenAI and run it as a for-profit (Ina Fried/Axios)
Report: Apple will stop selling iPhone SE and iPhone 14 series at the year's end in the EU, as the USB-C universal charging connector deadline comes into effect (Benjamin Mayo/9to5Mac)
Klarna CEO Sebastian Siemiatkowski says Klarna's investment in AI let it stop hiring a year ago and its headcount fell 22% to 3,500, mostly due to attrition (Bloomberg)
Private-credit firm Sixth Street commits $4B in capital for Affirm to underwrite short-term installment loans of between four and six months (Leslie Picker/CNBC)
